fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Sport, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication
inter_groups: ETOA is a member of NET (see www.net-tourism.eu) which was instrumental in supporting the set-up of an intergroup on tourism and related matters.
eu_initiatives:
1 Package travel and digital trading / online marketplace / Digital Single Market 
2. Indirect tax / tour operators margin scheme 
3. Visa requirements, code and practice 
4. Freedom to provide services / cross-border services / professional regulation 
5. Sustainability and capacity management 
6. European Capital of Smart Tourism 
7. Coach transport and driver regulation 
8. EU-China and other EU-long haul market trade and marketing initiatives
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
ETOA is a constituent member of NET, a network for European private sector tourism associations. See www.net-tourism.eu 
We are represented in the steering group for the Tourism Manifesto for Jobs and Growth. See: http://www.tourismmanifesto.eu
relevant_communication: See http://www.etoa.org/events and follow ETOA on twitter.
goals__remit:
ETOA is a trade association for tour operators and suppliers with business in European destinations. Over 950 members contribute more than €12bn of business within Europe and include tour and online operators, intermediaries and wholesalers; European tourist boards, hotels, attractions and other tourism suppliers. 
 
Our vision is to be the most influential driver for growth in European tourism and a trusted resource for policy makers and businesses. 
 
Our mission is to champion European tourism at EU, national and regional levels; provide valuable services and expertise to our members and partners; design and deliver market-leading trade events and seminars. 
 
We seek to act in the long term interests of European visitor economy such that destinations remain appealing places to live and visit and do business in, and thus remain a sustainable source of employment for the foreseeable future.
